intro: Myrmephytum beccarii, commonly known as the sandstone daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial with succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a circular pattern, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found on rocky outcrops or sandy soils. Myrmephytum beccarii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand drought conditions.
